comments.body: I much prefer specific imports, rather than underscores, since it's *very* easy to accidentally lose source compatibility with underscores. The only exception I make to this rule are things which contain implicits (e.g. `cats.implicits._`). Any names that I explicitly write though, I prefer to import just as explicitly, if only for documentation purposes.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +18,22 @@
import cats.Applicative
import cats.data._

import scala.concurrent.duration.FiniteDuration
